alert.note: Alert for Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 6:25PM CDT until May 13 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY... At 625 PM CDT, Emergency management reported several city streets flooded in Monmouth around 6 PM. Radar estimates between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monmouth, Roseville, Larchland, Warren County Fairgrounds, Ponemah, Ormonde, Swan Creek, Youngstown and Monmouth Municipal Airport. Cedar Creek and Town Branch Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
